meal.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: an occasion when you eat food, for example breakfast or dinner, or the food that you eat on that occasion
meal.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: We must have a meal together some time.
Dinner is the main meal of the day for most people.
meal.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: grain that has been crushed into a powder, for making flour or animal food
meal.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: We usually have our evening meal fairly early.
When they had eaten their meal, they went out for a walk.
Who cooks most of the meals?
The bar serves snacks and meals.
How about going out for a meal tonight?
He took Anna out for a meal and then to the theatre.
The evening meal is served at 7.30.
They had their main meal at lunchtime.
a three-course meal, including appetizer and dessert
We’ll get a good meal there.
I hadn’t had a decent meal in days.
We don’t have a big meal at lunchtime, usually just sandwiches.
With a hot meal inside me, I began to feel better.
‘It was a delicious meal, ’ Merrill said politely.
A heavy meal is likely to make you feel sleepy.
a simple meal of soup and bread
We make healthy, balanced meals for our children.
The day ended with a gourmet meal in a good restaurant.
Jennie cooked us a slap-up meal.
I’m not hungry enough to eat a full meal.
Healthy meals can still be quick and easy to prepare.
Many of the children are receiving free school meals.
Patients are advised to eat regular meals.
meal.translation[0].note_box[1].sections: types of meal
breakfast
a meal that you eat in the morning
brunch
a meal that you eat in the late morning, instead of breakfast or lunch
lunch
a meal that you eat in the middle of the day
tea
a meal that you eat in the afternoon or evening
dinner
the main meal of the day, which most people eat in the evening
supper
a small meal that you eat in the evening, in British English; the main meal that you eat in the evening, in American English
picnic
a meal that you eat outdoors, consisting of food that you cooked or prepared earlier
barbecue
a meal that you cook outdoors over hot coals or wood and eat outdoors
snack
a small amount of food that is eaten between main meals or instead of a meal
side dish
food eaten with the main course, such as vegetables
I’ll have the salad as a side dish.
course
one of the separate parts of a meal, such as the starter or the dessert
a three-course meal
parts of a large meal
hors d'oeuvre
the small first part of a meal
a tempting plate of hors d'oeuvres including olives and small pieces of roast beetroot
main course
the main part of a meal. entrée is used especially on restaurant menus
For the main course we had cheese and onion pie.
The menu includes a few hot entrées.
dessert
sweet food eaten at the end of a meal
What do you want for dessert?
They serve a wide range of desserts, including ice cream and home-made apple pie.
